intro: Lathyrus pannonicus subsp. pannonicus, commonly known as the Pannonian vetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, and it is often found in regions with temperate climates. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in soil stabilization and as a food source for various insect species.
